conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effect of light source position on shadow size and position.
Objects are casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Light source is positioned above and slightly behind the objects.
When the light source moves forward, it will affect the length and direction of the shadows.
Shadows will shift towards the position of the objects, moving backward on the ground.
Size of the shadows will increase as the angle of light becomes more acute.
Shadow A will move backward and become larger.
Shadow B will move backward and increase in size.
Shadow C will move backward and enlarge.
Shadow D will move backward and grow larger.
Shadows will move backward and increase in size due to change in angle of light source.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift backward and increase in size.
